alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 2:08PM MST until January 30 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and dangerous wind chills. Additional accumulations around 1 inch. Wind chills as low as 35 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Converse and Niobrara counties including the cities of Douglas and Lusk. * WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory until 11 AM MST Monday. Wind Chill Warning from 8 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to hypothermia and can cause frostbite on exposed skin in 10 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, including a knit hat and mittens. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
